author: Peter Wexler
comment: So far, I am using this application to inform me of e-mail updates by way of my new Motorola smartwatch. This software definitely makes the watch and my smartphone very interoperable.  Two thumbs up from me! Many thanks for a very nice piece of software!

author: DaterHill Project
comment: Based on the reviews and honestly how active the developer (s)  are. I decided to give this a shot. Keep up the great work!
title: Based on reviews...

author: Mike G
comment: Tried app after app, looking for one that would delete my hotmail emails and still display on my watch.  This app is the solution. Had issues with it at first, but the developer was extremely responsive and took care of my trouble quickly.  If you are looking for a similar solution, give this a try and if you have issues, contact the developer.  This one actually cares about their app.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Cheers Mike. For an app like WearMail, reliability is essential. But some re-work has been required recently to keep the app functioning on the newest versions of Android Thanks for your detailed report. Regards, Glen

title: Great app and developer!

author: Paul Cluett
comment: There doesn't seem to be a way of checking if it works or how to fix it. The switch off/ on notifications for phone or watch buttons are a little illogical: off for one, on for the other
title: Comms to the Watch seems to fail

author: craig freeman
comment: I have Been looking for a app that can delete my Hotmail emails on my watch and this works grate

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Craig. FYI: For anybody setting up a Hotmail account, it is important to use the full email address as the user name. Regards, Glen

title: Works

author: George Fong
comment: Brilliant app and brilliant support. Within minutes of contacting the developer about a bug with an Android update, he was onto it and was fixed  quickly. Essential app!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi George. Thanks. I'm always grateful when people take the time to report an issue to the support address. Regards, Glen

author: Tom Kannemann
comment: I have a Moto 360 and after some initial install issues which the developer quickly responded to it has worked flawlessly.
title: Best mail app for Android Wear

author: Douglas McLaren
comment: Works great for me on lg urbane 2nd edition...fabulous to be able to read whole emails and respond, right from watch...as Android wear should be able to out of the box, but strangely doesn't.

author: Hetal Patel
comment: The app worked great, but seems like updating to Nougat 7.1 on my Nexus6P has broken it.  No more notifications.  Can this be looked into?

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Hetal. Sorry about that. There is a new version rolling out 2.9 that is built on the Nougat 7.1 SDK using the newest build tools 25.0.0 and all the wear support libraries have been updated as well. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you need the apk. Regards, Glen

author: Dean Hammond
comment: And a little bit more. .. few bits not working notifications vibrate adjustment would be by what account sorted issues and now all good

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Dean. App version 2.5 should give you full control over vibrations including the ability to create your own arbitrarily complex vibration patterns. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you need anything. Regards, Glen

title: On the tin

author: Alexandre PAGE-RELO
comment: The app is plain awesome. should be standard Android wear mail behavior. BUT and it's a big one: (if I'm missing a setting correct me) the vibrating on each email on watch and phone is annoying as hell and no need for the notification on the phone at all. 5 star app, 1 star for notifications... bottom line 3!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Alexandre. Thanks. The vibration behaviour that you describe is standard notification framework behaviour as designed by Google. However, in the latest version of the app, 2.8, separate vibration patterns can be specified for the phone and watch including an option of 'None'. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Would be awesome without the vibration

author: Jay Leber
comment: Crashes on any Android wear setting as soon as you select, can't set Reply only Quick Reply.  Useless for notifications with options, but can speak subject and sender on phone!  Excellent if this were the only feature it had.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Jay. I've fixed the crash that you mention. What options would you find useful? I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Useless for notification options, great for speaking notification

author: Yvette Stewart
comment: Icon doesn't show up on app watch list so I can never go back to an email once I've swiped it away. Also I didn't see a vibration only notification, so I have to hear a loud beep every time I get an email. If the notification sound is not turned on, I never know if I have emails because no notification alerts me unless there is sound. Not even an icon popping up on the watch face.  The display of the email is good when I can see it. Lastly why doesn't it sync with phone so I can delete the email completely.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Yvette. No icon. WearMail is a custom plugin inside standard Android notifications. In app ver 2.8, separate vibrations can now be set for the watch and phone including 'None'. Also, the notification sound can be set to 'None'.  WM deletes email on the server. It cannot delete data from 3rd party apps: support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Where is the icon?

author: Phil M
comment: Works really well when this isn't switched on for your account, but won't verify or login at all when it is. Such a shame as that's becoming standard security advice to turn it on. Until that is implemented or fixed then I will unfortunately be uninstalling.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Phil. I used 2-step auth with my account. Tip: Do not enter the spaces shown in the 16 char app specific password. 2-step is no longer necessary, password-less auth using OAuth2 has been added to 2.8. It is no longer necessary to change your GMail security settings if the account is managed by the device. support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: 2-step authentication?

author: Evan Berry
comment: I like this app because it is a standalone app that connects to your email server and relays to your watch. You don't have to change your primary email app on your phone, but this app gives you full read and reply options. The downside is you cannot disable notifications on the phone without also disabling them on the watch. This is a huge drawback since I don't want dual notification of emails on my phone. Please fix!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Evan. Yes I agree. That's forced behaviour from the Google framework. The designers decided to have a mandatory summary notifice on the phone as a requisite for stacked notifices on the watch. in app version 2.8, I've re-written the standard framework to allow watch only notices. support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Would be great IF you could disable the notification on the phone but not the watch.

author: Jay Bee
comment: Is actually lets you look at multiple emails instead of one at a time like the stock program that comes with Google wear. I really wish they had text messenger because the Google wear text messenger is not as efficient once more than one text comes in. I just had to uninstall this app not because it doesn't work but because of its battery drain but it still is the best there is at what it does

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Jay. Thanks. As it happens, I do have an app that does stacked text notifications with commands. But I don't intend to add this to WearMail. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you want to discuss. Regards, Glen

title: Better than  Google cards

author: S Lovely
comment: It was working earlier but since I upgraded my phone it do not notify me of emails. I have reinstalled it 3, but still doesn't work. Smh, was a lovely app but now it do not show, send, nor notify the emails on my smart watch. Been crashing also

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi S Lovely, please press the 'report' button if you get a crash. When upgrading phones, you have to do a factory reset on the watch due to a defect in Android Wear. Failing that, clear the cache on the Android Wear app. Un-installing WearMail accomplishes nothing because it is Android Wear's job to deliver the notification. Regards, Glen

title: Disappointed

author: Tonya Weigand
comment: This use to work fine I have Moto 360 and and Samsung Galaxy S6 and was able to read my full emails but now I do not get anything on my phone what a big disappointment  disappointment.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Tonya. Do a factory reset on your watch. Due to a common Android Wear caching defect, app notifications get blocked when switching to a new phone. I've run into the same issue and the reset does fix it. Also, you might try app version 2.8, since it uses less of the standard android notification framework. support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Use to work

author: Jeremy Ripley
comment: Even if I have "vibrate when silent" set to off, it still makes my phone vibrate.   Having my phone vibrate every time i get an email would drive me crazy.    It's too bad, one flaw that ruins an otherwise useful app

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Jeremy. Vibrations have been fixed in version 2.8. The new version supports: 1. Separate vibrations for the phone and watch 2. The ability to disable vibrations 3. The ability to create your own vibration patterns. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: So close

author: Daya Here
comment: Does what it says. Only wish I could access/see my emails after the notification is gone...

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Daya. Thanks. The WearMail concept is aimed towards power notifications though a full email app is useful of course. In version 2.5 , I've added the ability to do non-stacked notifications. So you can get a separate notice for each email now if you wish. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you need anything. Regards, Glen

title: Works well

author: Jim T
comment: Can't connect to my Gmail account... Pointless.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Jim, I've implemented password-less authentication for GMail in app version 2.8. As long as your account is managed by the Android device, it is no longer necessary to enter a password or change your GMail settings. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: No use to me at all

author: Maria Rosero
comment: I will give it a five if the emails would come constantly as soon as I get them and will not disconnect

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Maria. In Android 6 Google has added battery saving features that work by turning the network OFF and disabling software. When the phone is not being moved, it is safest to leave it charging to ensure uninterrupted coverage. In app version, 2.8, new directives have been added to ensure that mail is sync'd as often as possible. Regards, Glen

author: Harold Miller
comment: Pretty solid, well supported and extremely configurable. All Wear developers could learn from this lad!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Cheers Harold. Please let me know what you think about the new version: 2.8. I've tried to address the majority of the issues that folks have raised. support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Well supported app

author: Steven Koch
comment: Exactly what I needed especially the quick reply options, developer is extremely responsive.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Steven!

title: Great App

author: Len Cook
comment: Does all I want it to

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Dad. I'm not sure that you're allowed to leave reviews, but I appreciate the sentiment. Now we just need to get mum a smartwatch. I'd recommend the iWatch gold! :) Cheers, your loving son

author: rudy martin
comment: All my emails in watch thanks

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Rudy. Thanks for supporting free software and being one of the good guys that gives something back! I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Nice

author: Darrell Christie
comment: Very useful app easy to set up too

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Darrel. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you need anything. Cheers, Glen

author: Dora Bowens
comment: Easy to use, very convenient

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Dora. I've tried to improve the ease of use further in app version 2.8. Account creation wizard, Password-less authentication for GMail, More attractive less cluttered UI, Better syncing of notifications between phone and watch. I'm at support@maxlamobile.com if you need anything. Regards, Glen

title: Good, easy to use app

author: Marcus Jess
comment: Decent app but could be better

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Marcus. Please try app version 2.8. I've tried to address most of the outstanding feedback in that version: Watch only notices, Ease of use, Vibration options, More notification options, Better syncing of notices between phone and watch. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Decent

author: Conrado Dy-Liacco
comment: Great app!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Conrado for supporting free software. I really appreciate it. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you ever need anything. Regards, Glen

author: Yvette Beck
comment: Love it!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Cheers Yvette

author: Jacob Bondt
comment: Piece of junk ,will not pair with my gmail,says it is invaild email and password. Have used this email for yrs with no trouble my phone is nexus 5 with Marshmallow 6.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Jacob, I've implemented password-less authentication for GMail in app version 2.8. As long as your account is managed by the Android device, it is no longer necessary to enter a password or change your GMail settings. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Sony sw 3

author: Benjamin Buzzard
comment: Does everything I wanted and more, this app allows you to pick from actions to quickly perform on your watch, read, reply, delete and much more from your wrist. Note though that this is not a full fledged email client, it's more of a email notifier that allows for quick response, and such. It does few things, but it does few things amazingly! (LG Watch Urbane)

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Benjamin. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you need anything. Regards, Glen

title: Works like a charm.

author: Rob Rainey
comment: I have the app in Silent mode and turned off Vibrate when in Silent, but my phone still vibrates every time I have new email messages.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Rob. This should be fixed in app version 2.8. If you're experiencing any issues, please contact me: support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Vibration setting doesn't seem to work

author: Trevor Whiteway
comment: Seems to do job. Only had watch for a week so still trying it out.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Trevor. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com if you need anything. Regards, Glen

title: Wear Mail

author: Matthew Stroh
comment: A great little app that customises email  notifications on both Z3 and LG R watch, and works with any email app. It means that 'delete/archive' is an option for all email apps on both the phone and watch notification, which is what I wanted so can clear sales etc email on receipt.  You need to set up all email accounts on the app, but there's great support via email if any problems (I got a reply and solution very promptly). Really impressed with this one, so it's very easy to recommend

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Matthew. I appreciate that. I'm happy to help any time. Cheers, Glen

title: Working great and very useful

author: Jack Miller
comment: Great app, allows me to configure work  email (IMAP) and view them on my moto 360. Default android mail only shows summary of mail on watch. Only two issues i see (or maybe just haven't figured out yet) are 1) it won't let me turn off notifications to my phone and 2) it marks my emails as read wick means when i go into my thunderbird client on laptop i can't tell what is new.  This is regardless of whether i actually viewed them on watch or not.  Fix those 2 things and we've got a 5 star app!

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Jack. 1: Watch only notifications are now possible in app version 2.8, 2: Your IMAP server has the unfortunate (and incorrect) behaviour of setting the SEEN flag whenever a message is retrieved by an automaton. In version 2.8, WearMail sets the PEEK flag to prevent this from happening. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Very nice, almost 5 star

author: Rick Mac Gillis
comment: I use this app for the same reason that others do; to receive email notifications on my smartwatch. I don't want my phone to get polluted with additional notifications along with the ones my mail app provides. Unfortunately I cannot turn them off individually.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Hi Rick. 1: In version 2.8, it is possible to do watch only notifications. 2: Turn on the 'Mail Delivery' option: 'Only favourite Contacts'. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen

title: Turn off phone notifications

author: Tony Fuller
comment: It works really well very pleased with the speed it opens up. Maybe missing something but as I use it for my gmail and one other non gmail account is there a way to send an email from my non gmail account from my moto 360 please? Thanks

author: Gareth Blades
comment: Very usefull app as the email client I use on the phone although the notifications can be sent to the phone they don't vibrate. Would be better if the phone notification could be disabled expecially as on the latest android the phone always vibrates which is annoying.

reply.author: Maxlab Mobile
reply.content: Thanks Gareth. Sorry, this wasn't possible previously due to limitations of the Android Framework. Version 2.8 contains a custom framework that enables watch only notifications and the ability to set a separate vibration pattern for the phone and watch, Including 'None'. I'm at support@maxlabmobile.com. Regards, Glen
